column4: hI I got the Ubuntu 9.10 down loaded and burned on a cd.  I don't see the option to live boot off the cd.  does that still work on version 9.10?
will it live boot?
what line to select will live boot the install?
ok thanks airtonix
I'll try it
You need to set the boot device in bios
it boots already I was just afraid it would wipe my hard drive
I just want to boot it
It won't wipe the drive, just do NOT use "install Ubuntu" option
that's the first line in 9.10 Install
Yes , if you want to install, but you can use it from the CD, just launch Firefox or whatever you want to test
I see no other line that says it will live boot in version 9.10
OH ok good enuf then airtronix
Thanks airtonix :)
here goes
seems your wrong about the Ubuntu 9.10 live boot thing when I selected install from boot it went as far as going to the partion disk
I stoped it there
Did you get to the desktop?
no
I rebooted to stop the partion of  my hard drives
Strange, I just did a clean install and it worked perfectly, you do a checksum on you cd?
